intro: Chilita plumosa, commonly known as the plumose chilita, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its soft, feathery foliage and clusters of small, pale yellow to white flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Chilita plumosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
